issues.description: The `addGuestStudents` method signature in the template repository includes an extra `boolean validateInput` parameter, which contradicts the problem statement's requirement and the solution's implementation. The problem statement (both text and UML diagram) specifies a method with a single `int` parameter, while the template provides a method with two parameters (`int`, `boolean`). This mismatch would confuse students and prevent them from implementing the method as specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of the `addGuestStudents` method in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java` from `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput)` to `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents)` to match the problem statement and solution.

issues.description: The `addGuestStudents` method signature in the template repository is inconsistent with the problem statement and the solution repository. The problem statement and UML diagram specify a method `addGuestStudents(int)`, while the template provides `addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput)`. This extra parameter (`validateInput`) is not mentioned in the requirements and will cause confusion for students trying to implement the method as specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the `addGuestStudents` method signature in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java` from `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput)` to `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents)` to align with the problem statement and the intended solution.
